newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Weaker crown pushes shorter Swedish debt yields up.
newsitem.headline: Weaker crown pushes shorter Swedish debt yields up.

text.p: The crown weakened sharply, sending shorter Swedish maturities up eleven basis points on Tuesday morning.
"Foreigners are selling Swedish shares and we have had a change in the way people are judging the development of rates. There does not seem to be time for another repo rate cut," one dealer said.

An auction today of seven billion crowns worth of March T-bills is also pushing up the shorter end, dealers said. The Riksbank kept its repurchase rate at an unchanged 4.10 percent at its weekly tender this morning, in line with expectations.

The longer maturities were only slightly up as stronger foreign markets held them back. A decision by trade union Metall to support Swedish membership in Europe's economic and monetary union helped the longer end.

The six-month T-bill rate was up eleven basis points at 4.33 percent and the ten year bond yield was one basis point higher at 7.38 percent. The crown softened to 4.5285 crowns to the mark versus 4.5005 crowns on Monday.
